brief_summary.textblock:
A prospective, observational study in a general hospital (UZ Leuven). Patients with delirium
      are included when they are treated with haloperidol. An ECG is taken before the
      administration of haloperidol and 3-5 days after starting haloperidol to investigate the
      change in duration of the QTc-interval. Risk factors for developing QT-prolongation will be
      documented. Together with ECG2, an additional blood sample will be collected to measure the
      blood concentration of haloperidol.

clinical_study.brief_title: Risk of QT-prolongation and Torsade de Pointes in Delirium Patients Treated With Haloperidol

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  treatment with haloperidol (indication: delirium)

          -  inpatient of UZ Leuven, admitted on one of the participating wards

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  < 18 years old

          -  DNR-code 2 or 3

          -  not possible to take an ECG before the start of haloperidol

study_pop.textblock: Patients with delirium treated with haloperidol. In a general hospital.
